objectives.objectiveDescription: Learn about various computing devices, their hardware and software components, and troubleshooting techniques.

expectations.expectationDescription: Select and operate commonly used devices to perform a variety of tasks.
Select and use hardware and software necessary for accomplishing a task.
Use problem-solving strategies to troubleshoot a problem.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Explore networking, cybersecurity, and the Internet of Things (IoT) to understand digital communication and data exchange.

expectations.expectationDescription: Describe how information can be communicated electronically to gain a deeper understanding of how information is transmitted (e.g., email, social media).
Use computing devices that are connected to share and receive information from the global community.
Explain and demonstrate secure practices (e.g., creating strong passwords) to protect private information.
Identify and discuss examples of how devices can be used with good and bad intentions.
With guidance and support, explain how devices connect and exchange data over different environments to explore how information is shared.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Focus on data collection, storage, visualization, communication, and analysis to understand and manipulate data.

expectations.expectationDescription: Collect and organize data to store, retrieve and modify.
Manipulate data to perform various tasks.
Organize, analyze and present data in various formats.
Interpret and analyze data, graphs, models or charts.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Learn about algorithms, program development, and other computational concepts to solve problems and express ideas.

expectations.expectationDescription: Model a real-world process by constructing and following step-by-step instructions (i.e., algorithms) to complete tasks.
Construct a model that shows the way programs store and manipulate data by using numbers or other symbols to represent information.
Develop a program that uses sequencing and repetition (i.e., loops) to solve a problem or express ideas.
Break down (i.e., decompose) a series of steps and separate the necessary from the unnecessary steps to create a precise sequence of instructions to solve a problem or express an idea.
Plan and create an artifact to illustrate thoughts, ideas and problems in a sequential (step-by-step) manner (e.g., story map, storyboard, sequential graphic organizer).
Identify and fix (i.e., debug) a multi-step process that includes sequencing.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Explore basic concepts of AI, including perception, machine learning, and societal impacts, to understand how AI influences various fields.

expectations.expectationDescription: Tell where sensors are on computers, robots and intelligent appliances to relate their location with their function such as motion, pressure/touch, temperature, proximity, light, sound, moisture or gases.
Apply the use of intelligent agents to assist in basic research (look up answers to specific questions).
With guidance and support, create a simple decision tree (conditionals) to create a pathway for decisions.
Use a classifier that recognizes drawings and discuss how the program knows what they are drawing.
List possible attributions computers can use to distinguish humans from each other by comparing these attributions.
To determine how AI can help in daily life, group applications used into two categories: 'AI' and 'Not AI.'
Discuss AI and how it can be used for good or bad to discuss the ethical use of AI.

objectives.objectiveDescription: Study the effects of computing on culture, social interactions, and ethical issues to foster informed and responsible use of technology.

expectations.expectationDescription: Compare and contrast how the use of technology has changed to understand its impact on everyday life.
Describe the ways people use technologies in their daily work and personal lives to understand technology's impact on one's community.
Compare and contrast safe and responsible behaviors to those that are not when using information and technology.
Discuss appropriate and ethical uses of technology to guide informed decisions.
Compare and contrast appropriate and inappropriate behavior online, including cyberbullying, and the steps to keep yourself and others safe and out of harm's way.

Use problem-solving strategies to troubleshoot a problem.
Describe how information can be communicated electronically to gain a deeper understanding of how information is transmitted.
Use computing devices that are connected to share and receive information from the global community.
Explain and demonstrate secure practices (e.g., creating strong passwords) to protect private information.

outline.title: Good and Bad Uses of Devices

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Begin planning final interdisciplinary projects that incorporate various techniques and concepts learned during the year.

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Develop and refine final interdisciplinary projects.

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Continue refining final interdisciplinary projects.

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Finalize interdisciplinary projects, preparing for presentation.

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Present final interdisciplinary projects to the class, explaining the integration of various concepts.

sections.sSID: CS, NI, DA, ATP, AI, IC
sections.sectionDescription: Celebrate the accomplishments and projects completed during the year.
